meanings.definition: The act or process of relieving congestion.
meanings.sent1: After taking the medicine, the decongestion of my nose was noticeable.
meanings.sent2: The decongestion of traffic was achieved by opening an additional lane.
meanings.sent3: The decongestion of the crowded elevator brought a sense of relief to everyone inside.
meanings.sent4: The decongestion of ideas in his mind allowed him to think more clearly.
meanings.sent5: The decongestion of the clogged drain was a satisfying sight.

meanings.definition: The state of being free from congestion.
meanings.sent1: The decongestion of the city streets made commuting much easier.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of decongestion after the busy holiday season was over.
meanings.sent3: The decongestion of the refrigerator shelves made it easier to find what she needed.
meanings.sent4: The decongestion of the internet traffic allowed for faster browsing speeds.
meanings.sent5: The decongestion of the waiting room brought a sense of calm to the patients.
